Synopsis:
Inspired by true story and real-life characters, Pleasure Factory,
shot on actual locations, tells an intriguing and intimate tale involving
pleasure seekers and pleasure providers in Geylang: Singapore&#039;s popular but 
little known red-light district. Over the course of one night, a young cadet 
loses his virginity; a teenage girl gets initiated into the pleasure manufacturing
process; and a jaded prostitute pays a young busker good money in exchange
for a song he never gets to sing...

Notes:
Written and directed by award-winning Thai director Ekachai Uekrongtham
(Beautiful Boxer). It stars Golden Horse Actress winner Yang Kuei-Mei
(The wayward Cloud, Vive L&#039;Amour, Eat Drink Man Woman) and Ananda Everingham 
(Shutter) alongside a cast of fresh talents found through street casting in
and aroung Singapore. The cast includes Loo Zihan, Xu Er, Isabella Chen,
Jeszlene Devon Zhou, Ian Francis Low and Katashi Chen.

The film was an Official Selection at the sixty Cannes International Film Festival
in the Uncertain Regard section. After which, it has been invited to a number of 
film festivals around the world, include Pusan International Film Festival in Korea 
and Montreal World Film Festival in Cananda.
